topic: Test Reliability Made Practical: KR‑20, Cronbach’s α, and Building a Consistent Quiz
target_audience: assessment leads, teachers managing large banks

refs.content: Introduces KR‑20 for dichotomous items; foundational internal consistency coefficient for test reliability.
α as a general reliability coefficient; assumptions, interpretation and links to test length and variance.
Practical guidance on using α in medical education; cautions about dimensionality and item homogeneity.

special_instructions: Provide rule‑of‑thumb thresholds, how to raise reliability (length, quality, alignment), and a caution box about multidimensional tests.
